runs.comm: starts full, Trott is hanging on the back foot and mistimes it to point
Trott shuffles across his crease, as he loves doing, and clips it firmly to deep midwicket for a couple
walking across his stumps and is struck bang in front but the ball was going over the stumps
slightly down the leg side, Trott tries to get it away but misses out and the wicketkeeper collects
good probing line around off stump, Trott tries to guide it away but gets too much of it and it trickles into the point region for a single
Denly survives his first ball, mistiming an attempted off-side force into the covers
shortish and Trott guides it into the leg side for a single
slightly flat-footed drive from Denly, timing it well into the covers
shoved down the leg side, Trott misses the attempted flick, but is compensated by the umpire calling wide
slightly back of a length on off stump and blocked into the off side
shortish, Trott tries to flick it into the leg side but it goes straight to the short-midwicket fielder who throws down the stumps at the non-strikers end in a flash, but Denly's dive saves him

ideal for Pakistan as Denly fails again! Tries to force it straight back down the ground but gets an inside edge that shoots straight to the short-midwicket fielder. Almost paid the price for trying to be too technically correct.
gets a wide first up, well outside off and left alone
into the action straight away, skipping down the wicket at Arafat, and flicking down to fine leg for a single
Pietersen on the walk again, gets into a slightly awkward position playing across the ball, and mistimes it into the off side
Pietersen is taking guard well outside the popping crease and lunges forward, driving straight to a deep-set mid-off fielder
walking down the wicket and swiping at one outside off, finds nothing but fresh air
Trott's gone! Razzaq strikes! Good tight line outside off, Trott plays a bit of a nothing shot trying to guide it down to third man, only ends up inside-edging on to off stump
tries to nurdle it straight away, clipping to square leg
back of a length and blocked into the off side to complete a top over from Razzaq
Pakistan going well here, Pietersen trying to force the pace with a leg-side flick but doesn't time it at all
he again can't get it away, taking a ball from middle and guiding it straight to midwicket
nicely played, read the pitched-up slower ball and waited for it, before driving stylishly back over the bowler's head for a boundary
driving firmly again, straight to the mid off fielder
good delivery, arrow straight and Collingwood blocks firmly back to the bowler
good finish to a very tidy over, straight and the batsman can doing nothing but defend. Pakistan well in the game now
Razzaq continues, Pietersen maintains his positive approach, skipping down the wicket a fraction and driving, but off the edge, through the point region for a couple

Gone! Collingwood departs and Pakistan are on fire! Pietersen clipped it neatly towards the deep midwicket region, Collingwood called for a second but the throw came in to the bowlers end and, despite a dive, he wasn't back in time
once again defended uneasily off the front foot
ooh close! Outside off and Pietersen inside-edges past the stumps down to fine leg
Morgan times his first ball perfectly, but straight to the cover fielder
well timed again, leaning on a fuller ball and guiding it through the straight-mid-on region for a couple
Pietersen drives a fullish ball and is so pleased with the shot he runs but the mid off is set deep and its a comfortable single
drifts too far down the leg side and the umpire decides it's wide
outside off stump, Morgan looks very relaxed and leaves it alone
full again and clipped firmly and finely down to fine leg where a diving, sprawling stop keeps it to two
driven crisply down to mid off from a fullish ball
good, probing line, full and Morgan can only push it gently to mid off
another dot ball to finish, defended to mid off. End of the fielding restrictions and at the equivalent time Pakistan were 25 for 2. So pretty even here.
slightly short and worked into the leg side
very wide and offering to spin wider outside off stump, Morgan leaves it alone
similar line but this time the wicketkeeper lets it go through his legs and it runs away for a couple
much better, tight on off stump, and defended
outside off again and Morgan gets down on one knee and sweeps crisply and firmly to deep square
slightly short and Pietersen cuts to short third-man, where a misfield allows an extra run
Pietersen shuffles across his stumps and sweeps powerfully from outside off down to fine leg for a boundary, good shot
arrowed down the leg side too far, another wide
worked down the ground from a fullish length for another single
without looking fluent, Pietersen is playing a crucial role here, driving without much timing away for another single
calmly watched on to the bat, and dabbed into the covers for one
drifts into the legs and Pietersen plays his favourite clip shot, timing it well this time, but straight to the deep square on the leg side
slightly short and outside off stump, Morgan was in position quickly but couldn't time his cut shot
fuller this time and blocked into the covers
good finish to the over, bang on target, Morgan drops it into the off side and the batsmen scamper a swift single, good cricket
starts with a loopy delivery pitched perfectly on off stump, Morgan waits on it and defends with an inside edge out to fine leg
nicely delivered again, straight and Pietersen is watchful, defending back to the bowler
fullish, Pietersen bristling, but can't quite force more than a single into the leg side from a straight ball
Morgan really sniffing the ball, right over it and defending for his life
well this is what Morgan made his name doing, gets into position very early and dab-flicks a paddle shot to fine leg
firmly clipped into the leg side for a single
starts well straight away, finding some away movement and beating Pietersen outside off stump. The wicketkeeper fumbles and the batsmen cross
Morgan is once again very watchful, defending back to Gul
very lucky for Morgan, Gul causing trouble straight away, short ball, which has caused difficulty for the batsmen all day, Morgan top-edges and it loops agonisingly over the mid on fielder
Pietersen is right back and forcing this into the covers for a single
another good short ball, zips past Morgan as he sways inside the line and carries nicely through to the wicketkeeper
top bowling, quick, back of a length, straight, and Morgan can do nothing but defend
Pietersen is doing all kinds of fancy footwork before the delivery is bowled, ends up in a conventional position and works an off-stump delivery into the off side
nicely played, flashing drive through the covers for a couple
massive, stretched, pleading appeal from one that crashes into Morgan's pads just outside off, as he missed a sweep shot
driven firmly away for one
well bowled, Pietersen looking for a big shot but it's slightly quicker and dead straight, the batsman defends
full and driven down the ground for another single
Gul continues to give little away, just back of a length on off stump, Pietersen works it into the off side for one
nothing Morgan can do with that, zipping on to him from back of a length and he prods it into the midwicket region
not a great delivery this, looking for the yorker but it's too far down leg side, clips the pads and runs away for four down to fine leg
shuffling down the wicket and guides it down to third man for another single
full and straight, Pietersen looking for a big drive down the ground, doesn't time it perfectly but picks up one as mid off fields
poor finish from Gul and ideal for Morgan. Short and down the leg side, Morgan times a pull shot perfectly and the ball flies down to fine leg for six to bring up the 50 partnership
Pietersen looking for a big shot, drifts outside leg stump and misses an attempted off-side swipe
plays this one better into the leg side and collects a couple
tickled away into space for one
just outside off, Morgan cuts nicely away for a couple
well played again, Morgan looking very calm, just guides into space in the cover region for an easy single
lovely shot, skips down the wicket, and flicks straight of midwicket with perfect timing for a boundary
Morgan advances down the track but it's a good delivery and well defended
lovely shot, really well played, waited on a slightly leg-sided delivery and tickled it away for four
good comeback from Razzaq, much fuller and caught Morgan on his crease, he shapes a off-side drive and is sneaks between bat and pad perilously close to the off stump
excellent shot again, down on one knee and flicking a fullish leg-side ball away for another boundary
excellent shot again, this time it was slightly short and he rocked back and crashed it away in front of midwicket for a boundary
delicate this time, waiting on it nicely and working it down towards fine leg for another couple. These two going very well now
this is shoved down the leg side, too far for Pietersen's sweep and too far for the umpire's liking
better line and Pietersen can only defend
full and straight and driven very correctly with a straight bat past the bowler for a single
shortish ball, doosra I think, and Morgan doesn't time his cut shot but gets a single to point
slightly quicker outside off, Pietersen cuts down to third man for a couple
well defended this time, no need to take any risks at this stage
driven again, firmly down the ground
good delivery, back of a length on off stump, pushed to mid off for a sharp single
well, that is an excellent shot. Short-arm jabbing a ball which was only just short of a good length, and timing it perfectly for four well in front of midwicket
slightly fuller this time and pushed calmly into the off side
fuller this time from Gul, Morgan waits and drives effortlessly straight over Gul's head for four. Top shot
real effort ball from Gul, don't think he took too kindly to being pumped back over his head, sharp and shorter and flashes past the outside edge of Morgan's back-foot forcing shot
fuller and clipped into the leg side where a misfield at midwicket allows an extra run
nicely bowled, full and clipped neatly to straight midwicket
replay of the last ball, clipped firmly straight to the fielder at short, straight midwicket
this time he gets it away, driving nicely down the ground
bit of a needless reverse-sweep for Morgan here, misses and it crashes into the pads
another needless reverse-sweep, didn't play it well at all but a misfield allows runs. Horrid mix up, Morgan dives and reaches his fifty with an ungainly sprawling finish
less incident here, worked away for a single
full and Morgan is down on one knee, dabbing it behind him to fine leg for a single
nicely played but Pietersen, dropping into the leg side and scampering through for a single
shorter and cut away but straight to the fielder at point
attempts a flamboyant sweep but swings at fresh air
doosra here, Morgan doesn't read it from the hand but forces it away for one
nicely bowled, tight on the stumps and Pietersen can't get it away
oh dear, Pakistan don't want that, it's short and outside off stump, Morgan flashes a cut to the third man boundary to bring up the 100-run stand
fuller this time and swung away for another four down to square leg, brings up the highest partnership for any wicket for England in T20 cricket
Morgan finishes it in style! Short and Morgan, up on one leg, smashes a pull shot miles over fine leg for six. What an innings from Morgan! England win by seven wickets
